title: Lord Kerslake's 'crossbench' status questioned as he takes the reins of McDonnell-backed think tank
text:
A "crossbench" peer is facing renewed questions about his independence after revealing that he is now heading a think tank with close links to the Labour front bench.

Lord Kerslake, the former Cabinet Secretary, who was already under pressure to relinquish his status as an independent peer over his role advising Jeremy Corbyn, has been appointed as chairman of the New Economics Foundation, which has devised radical plans adopted as a flagship Labour policy.

The peer, 64, registered the new role with the parliamentary authorities earlier this month. The disclosure comes after The Sunday Telegraph revealed last week that Lord Kerslake was under pressure from fellow peers to give up his "crossbench"...
description: A "crossbench" peer is facing renewed questions about his independence after revealing that he is now heading a think tank with close links to the Labour front bench.
